alert.note: Alert for Coweta; Meriwether; Troup (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 20 at 12:53AM EDT by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northern Meriwether, northeastern Troup and southeastern Coweta Counties through 130 AM EDT... At 1252 AM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was over Lone Oak, or 12 miles northwest of Greenville, moving east at 10 mph. HAZARD...Up to 40 mph wind, frequent cloud to ground lightning and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects. Heavy rain may cause temporary street flooding especially in poor drainage areas. Locations impacted include... Hogansville, Grantville, Luthersville, Haralson, Lone Oak, Gay, Alvaton, Rocky Mount, Saint Marks and Wooster. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: People outdoors should seek shelter immediately. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Motorists should slow down and be prepared for possible loss of control due to hydroplaning.
